pt.pa.graph

Class GraphController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.pa.graph.GraphController

  • public class GraphController
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphController(LogisticNetwork logisticNetwork)
      The constructor of Controller class used in MVC pattern

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addButtons()
      This method is responsible for setting all the triggers of the buttons which were added
      void addEdge()
      This method is responsible in adding edges to our graph, calling upon the view to obtain the user inputs and using them to create an edge in the model
      void applyBFS()
      This method is responsible into managing the BFS algorithm, obtaining the input of the user and try to apply it into the logical part of our MVC pattern (Model)
      void dijkstra()
      This method is responsible in managing the dijkstra algorithm, it obtains the input of the user and tries to apply the algorithm to both locations, finding then a result and displaying it in a listview
      void displayAdjacency()
      This method is responsible for displaying an adjacency list everything is shown in a listview
      void metrics()
      This method is responsible for showing all the metric calculations Placing them all in a listview while also making a bar chart of the top 5 Hubs
      void removeEdge()
      This method is responsible in removing edges to our graph, calling ypon the view to obtain the user inputs and using them to remove an edge in the model
      void save()
      This method will be used to save/overwrite the new route file with the current changes we applied to our graph
      void undo()
      Undos an action, restoring into a previous state and notify the view that such change has occured

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphController

        public GraphController(LogisticNetwork logisticNetwork)
        The constructor of Controller class used in MVC pattern
        Parameters:
        logisticNetwork - this paramether contains all the necessary data to create a graph

    • Method Detail

      • addButtons

        public void addButtons()
        This method is responsible for setting all the triggers of the buttons which were added

      • metrics

        public void metrics()
        This method is responsible for showing all the metric calculations Placing them all in a listview while also making a bar chart of the top 5 Hubs

      • displayAdjacency

        public void displayAdjacency()
        This method is responsible for displaying an adjacency list everything is shown in a listview

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge()
             throws Alerts
        This method is responsible in adding edges to our graph, calling upon the view to obtain the user inputs and using them to create an edge in the model
        Throws:
        Alerts - if the distance isn't a number or if the user hasn't selected 2 locations then the user will receive a pop-up

      • removeEdge

        public void removeEdge()
                throws Alerts
        This method is responsible in removing edges to our graph, calling ypon the view to obtain the user inputs and using them to remove an edge in the model
        Throws:
        Alerts - if the user hasnt selected 2 locations

      • undo

        public void undo()
          throws Alerts
        Undos an action, restoring into a previous state and notify the view that such change has occured
        Throws:
        Alerts - This alert is thrown from the caretaker in case theres a failure in restoring a previous state

      • save

        public void save()
          throws Alerts
        This method will be used to save/overwrite the new route file with the current changes we applied to our graph
        Throws:
        Alerts - in case one of the auxiliary methods triggers an exception then a pop-ip will show

      • dijkstra

        public void dijkstra()
              throws Alerts
        This method is responsible in managing the dijkstra algorithm, it obtains the input of the user and tries to apply the algorithm to both locations, finding then a result and displaying it in a listview
        Throws:
        Alerts - If two locations haven't been chosen then an exception wil be triggered and a pop up will be displayed to the user

      • applyBFS

        public void applyBFS()
              throws Alerts
        This method is responsible into managing the BFS algorithm, obtaining the input of the user and try to apply it into the logical part of our MVC pattern (Model)
        Throws:
        Alerts - if one of the inputs the user submitted is incorrect then a pop up will be displayed to the user
